intro: Galium × pomeranicum subsp. hillardiae, commonly known as the creeping bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
